{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, the middle constrictor of the pharynx originates from the greater and lesser horns of the hyoid bone and the stylohyoid ligament. It inserts into the pharyngeal raphe and blends with fibers of the superior and inferior constrictors. There is no mention of attachment from the mandible, pterygomandibular raphae, or cricoid cartilage. Therefore, the correct answer is A. Body of hyoid bone.", "answer_choice": "A"}
